newsitem.title: UK: IPE GAS OIL CLOSES $2.75 DOWN, BRENT CUTS LOSSES.
newsitem.headline: IPE GAS OIL CLOSES $2.75 DOWN, BRENT CUTS LOSSES.

text.p: IPE August gas oil futures closed $2.75 a tonne down on Thursday, returning to the lower range of the day's trade with little inspiratin from NYMEX, brokers said.
August gas oil closed at $172.50 a tonne, or 50 cents off the day's low when the whole IPE complex slipped under pressure from expectations that Iraq will start selling crude soon.
The contract recovered a little after NYMEX products performed better than expected at the open but it soon went back further in the red.
"It was so dull...A lot of jobbing but very little paper, no arb buying," one broker said.
"The volume has been poor, most of it done on the spread. There was not a lot of movement in (NYMEX) heating oil to inspire any movement in gas oil," a second broker said.
Meanwhile, September Brent continued to trade in negative territory but having also cut some more of its early losses.
September was seven cents down at $19.13 a barrel at 1653 GMT compared with an intra-day low of $18.88 before the NYMEX open.
